Post_Text: In this episode of Digital Dialogues, Deputy Minister of @MoEDmv, Dr. Aishath Shahudha Abdulla explains how the Digital Creative Economy is empowering Maldivian creators. Watch now: [link] #DTP #DigitalMaldives

In this episode, Abo Shafyu and Shazif Adam from @encreastudio share how @akurutype is shaping the future of Dhivehi fonts, bridging heritage, design, and technology. #DTP #DigitalMaldives

APCICT, in partnership with @MSFDmv held a WIFI DX Training of Trainers in Male, Maldives, from 14 to 17 December 2025. The workshop equipped future trainers with the mindset, knowledge, and skills needed to support women entrepreneurs in embracing digital transformation.

In 2025 the company was renamed Mdv Innovation and Digital Company Limited to reflect its expanded role as the govt's digital & innovation arm under the Maldives 2.0 digital transformation agenda, signifying a shift toward broader digital public services beyond trade facilitation

Every crazy idea is the beginning of something extraordinary. When our youth combine bold imagination with the power of technology, they create solutions that move us closer to a truly #DigitalMaldives. The future of this nation will be shaped by the young innovators who dare to think differently. - Khalid Al-Hamadi, CEO & MD
Police Service Launches Major Digital Transformation Under Maldives 2.0 Agenda [link]

The Training of Trainers program on Empowering Women Entrepreneurs through Digital Transformation, jointly organised by the Ministry and APCICT, commenced today. This capacity-building program brings together participants from MSFD, Bank of Maldives (BML), SME Digital, and the Business Centre Corporation (BCC), with a focus on strengthening their ability to support women entrepreneurs in harnessing digital tools and platforms for sustainable business growth and resilience in the digital economy @APCICT @BCC_mv @SMEdigital_mv @bankofmaldives

#MeetJudge Aminath Farshana is a seasoned software engineer and technology leader working at the intersection of AI, digital transformation, and DevSecOps. #YouthHackMV #YouthHack25 @AminathFarshana @womenintechmv @YouthGovMv
Does a new app change who you are? Maldives 0.2 corruption through digital transformation

#MeetMentor Mariyam Asna Saeed is a software developer with over 12 years of experience, specializing in digital transformation. An Initiative of @youthgovmv under Maldives 2.0 @digitalgovmv Main Partner: @ooredoomaldives
Here's how we served you through 2025! A year of progress shaped together with the people and institutions we serve. #MINDCo #DigitalMaldives #Innovation #Transformation

Minister of State Dr. Kinaanath launched the Child Online Protection Training of Trainers Program and National CSIRT Assessment Programs organized by the National Cyber Security Agency of Maldives in partnership with @ITU. #maldivespolice #DigitalMaldives

Congratulations Pinetworks Pvt Ltd! Winner of MSME of the Year (Tech) at the Maldives MSME Award 2025. Recognising excellence in innovation, technology, and digital transformation. @pinetworks @MoEDmv #bcc #msmeaward2025 #dhiveheenahiskan

Strengthening support for persons with disabilities across the Maldives. Register in the National Disability Registry and access the monthly Disability Allowance easily through oneGov. http://one.gov.mv @NSPAmaldives #NSPA #oneGov #DigitalMaldives

Alhamdhlillaahi! Honoured that Javaabu has been awarded Next-Gen MSME of the Year at the Maldives MSME Awards 2025 by @BCC_mv — recognized for driving tech-forward innovation and advancing digital transformation across the Maldives.

Can the #Maldives realistically achieve a digital economy contributing 15% of GDP by 2030 under the Maldives2.0 plan, given challenges in e-governance, #AI, and #blockchain adoption? #DigitalEconomy #GovernanceReform @HomeMinistrymv @MoEDmv #VisitMaldives

The officiating meeting for the Digital Transformation Officers of Maldives 2.0 was held today at NCIT. Representatives from various agencies participated in the session, where they were updated on the latest developments of Maldives 2.0 and briefed on their roles in President's National Digital Transformation Initiative. #Maldives2Point0 #DigitalGovMV #Maldives

Ooredoo Maldives showcases Next-Generation AI-Powered eKYC Solution at Mobile World Congress, Doha. Designed fully in-house, our new system delivers faster, safer, and fully automated digital onboarding. #DigitalMaldives #UpgradeYourWorld

An officiating meeting for the Digital Transformation Officers of Maldives 2.0 was held today at NCIT. Participants from various agencies were updated on current developments and briefed on their roles in this pivotal national digital transformation initiative. #DigitalGovMv

The Maldives 2.0 Blueprint sets the direction for our national digital transformation over the next four years. With 54 priority actions underway, Maldives 2.0 is moving from strategy to implementation. #Maldives2Point0 #DigitalGovMv #Maldives

The Dhivaru subsea cable turns the #Maldives into a strategic #digital gateway, linking its #maritime heritage to a future powered by #AI and high-speed global #connectivity. #DhivaruCable #MaldivesDigitalHub #AIConnectivity #SubseaCables #DigitalMaldives #VisitMaldives

Delhi: DIDAC India 2025 inaugurated its 15th edition at Yashobhoomi. Speaking at the event, Maldives Minister of Higher Education, Labour and Skills Development, Munim Anees says, Digital transformation will strengthen government services, enhancing education delivery through schools and supporting workforce development, aiming to improve skill creation and overall efficiency in public service sectors...

Google's new subsea cable project transforms the #Maldives into a #strategic, sustainable #digital #hub supporting global #data flows and future AI-driven demand. #DigitalMaldives #GoogleDhivaru #IndianOceanHub #SubseaCables #AI #connectivity #VisitMaldives

Google's decision to invest in the Maldives is a strong signal of global confidence in our stable, transparent, and investor-friendly environment. President Dr. @MMuizzu #Dhivaru #DigitalMaldives #DigitalGovMV
The Maldives is ready to take a proactive and impactful role in shaping the future of global digital infrastructure. President Dr. @MMuizzu #Dhivaru #DigitalMaldives #DigitalGovMV

Transformative! Dhivaru project by @Google puts Maldives on the map as a key connectivity hub, aligning with @MMuizzu's national digital transformation strategy Maldives 2.0. Investor confidence will soar!

Deputy Commissioner General of Taxation, Ms. Fathimath Ameeza delivered the keynote address for the session on pro-active compliance tools and digital transformation. During her address, she urged to look beyond the traditional lens of enforcement and consider how proactive engagement and digital innovation can foster a culture of compliance. #GulhigenMIRA #CAMaldives #maldivestaxforum2025

Technology doesn't build a digital nation, people do. It is not only dependent on IT expertise, anyone with the mindset to embrace change has a role in shaping the #DigitalMaldives. Our CCO Hussain Niyaz highlighted during his talk about the transformative role of fintech in shaping the Maldives' economic future during the @MMA_Maldives Conference panel Rethinking Economic Growth Beyond Tourism held today at Villa Nautica. @hniyaz

Heartfelt congratulations to the 17 girls who completed the #GirlsToCodeMV 2025 Male' edition! Remember, this is just the beginning of your journey. We are so excited to watch you innovate, create, and lead the Maldives into a brighter tech future. @Dhiraagu @girlstocodemv

Speaking at the event, our President, @NahzaI, encouraged the #GirlsToCodeMV participants to continue building on the skills gained through the program and pursue further upskilling to support their education and career growth. @Dhiraagu @girlstocodemv

Dhiraagu CEO & MD, Ismail Rasheed, spoke at the #GirlsToCodeMV closing event, noting that supporting women in tech is a key part of @Dhiraagu's sustainability efforts, helping young women build skills and confidence while exploring diverse opportunities. @girlstocodemv

We were pleased to have Minister, Dr. Ali Haidar Ahmed, @MoHEmv, as Chief Guest at the #GirlsToCodeMV 2025 closing ceremony. He emphasized that technology is rapidly evolving and transformative, making digital skills essential for everyone in daily life. @Dhiraagu @girlstocodemv

We've officially concluded the 6th edition of #GirlsToCodeMV 2025 in Male. Together with @Dhiraagu, we are proud to have trained 108 girls so far, empowering young women with the tools they need to lead in today's digital-first world. @girlstocodemv

Cyberstalking is repeated online monitoring, messages or tracking used to control or intimidate. 1 in 3 women have experienced stalking, in-person or online. 80% of all stalking victims are tracked using digital technology. #16DaysOfActivism #16Days #OrangeTheWorld #UNiTE

It is NOT Revenge. It is Digital Violence. Sharing intimate images or videos of someone without their explicit consent, or even threatening to do so, is a serious crime. 90% of image-based abuse victims are WOMEN. #16DaysOfActivism #16Days #OrangeTheWorld #NoExcuse #UNiTE

Sharing or commenting on doxing posts doesn't make you a bystander, it makes you part of the harm. For women, this can escalate into serious online & offline harassment. Your clicks have consequences. Don't share doxed information #16DaysOfActivism #16Days #UNiTE #OrangeTheWorld

Deepfakes are real & they are overwhelmingly weaponized to harass, exploit & silence women. If you come across a suspicious image or video, especially one showing a woman in a compromising situation: Don't share it, Don't engage. REPORT it #16DaysOfActivism #UNiTE #OrangeTheWorld

Calling on digital creators, IT & ICT community. We are joining the Digital Visioning Workshop by @nexiamv for the 20-Year NDP. Come & share your ideas, experiences & help shape digital future of Maldives. 4 Dec 2025, 19:45, 6th Flr, Umar Zahir Office Building, Hulhumale

Maldives 2.0 (@digitalgovmv) is our vision for the future—a Digital-First Maldives built for every citizen, every island, and every generation to come. These 8 Pillars shape how we build, connect, govern, protect rights, promote transparency, and restore trust in public institutions. Learn more at: [link] #DigitalGovMv #Maldives

President Dr @MMuizzu attends the inaugural session of the Maldives 2.0 Digital Transformation Summit. The summit kicks off dialogue on materialising the President's @digitalgovmv vision, whereby Maldives aims to transform its public service landscape through sectoral digital transformation, citizen-centric e-governance services built on secure and sovereign digital infrastructure. Backed by a modern legal framework and cyber security, this is anticipated to provide the necessary momentum towards a resilient and diverse economy. #DigitalGovMv #Maldives

President Dr @MMuizzu attends the closing ceremony of the Maldives 2.0 Digital Transformation Summit. The summit gathered key stakeholders from government agencies alongside local and international experts to discuss the realisation of the President's @digitalgovmv vision. This vision aims to revolutionise the public service sector through digital transformation, focusing on citizen-centric e-governance services built on secure and sovereign digital infrastructure. Digital Transformation Maldives 2.0 envisions a journey towards a faster, smarter, Digital First Maldives. #DigitalGovMv #Maldives

President Dr @MMuizzu meets with TikTok's senior delegation to discuss potential areas of collaboration. He shared his vision for digitalisation in the Maldives, while TikTok's team highlighted how they can support that vision. Both sides expressed optimism for future cooperation.

We're investing in key areas that will define the next generation of growth for the Maldives — creative industries, infrastructure development, human capital, and digital transformation - President Dr Muizzu

The Maldives is committed to building a digital world that is inclusive, resilient, and just - President Dr Muizzu during his opening remarks as co-chair at the Summit of the Future: Interactive dialogue 3: Towards a Common Digital Future. #MaldivesAtUNGA79 #UNGA79 #OurCommonFuture

Our vision is a Maldives where digital innovation is the engine driving economic opportunity and social equity - President Dr Muizzu during his statement at the Plenary of Summit of the Future. #MaldivesAtUNGA79 #UNGA79 #OurCommonFuture

To address challenges in the Maldives we've established the National Cybersecurity Agency to address security concerns that arise in digitalization - President Dr Muizzu during his opening remarks as co-chair at the Summit of the Future: Interactive dialogue 3: Towards a Common Digital Future. #MaldivesAtUNGA79 #UNGA79 #OurCommonFuture
The President envisions a Maldives where digital innovation empowers young people, and drives economic opportunity and social equity [link] #MaldivesAtUNGA79 #UNGA79

First Lady @sajidhaamohamed officially inaugurates Vara Expo 2025, the largest and most comprehensive skills and career exposition in the Maldives. This year's edition aims to advance youth development through digital innovation by addressing critical national challenges such as cumbersome application processes, fragmented access to government services, and skills-market misalignment. Organised by the Ministry of Higher Education, Labour and Skills Development, this Expo provides a platform connecting organisations with job seekers, students, and professionals.

Introducing Dhivaru, a new Trans-Indian Ocean subsea cable by @Google, announced at the first Maldives Global Investors Forum. This marks a historic milestone for #DigitalMaldives and global connectivity.
Warmly welcome Google's strategic investment in Dhivaru cable. This will position Maldives as a key digital hub in the Indian Ocean region.
Google's submarine cable entry into the Maldives is a political and economic loss. By giving away control of this sector, we lose strategic leverage over our own digital future.
Google's Dhivaru validates the strategic groundwork laid previously for digital infrastructure. A proud moment for the nation.
What revenue or economic gains can the Maldives expect from the Dhivaru cable project? The public is eager to understand the tangible benefits.
Maldives to build $9B blockchain hub as part of digital transformation push. Major international partnerships expected.
Inauguration of e-Visa and Digital Services under the Maldives 2.0 initiative. Citizens and visitors can now access streamlined digital government services. #DigitalGovMV
Digital literacy training session completed in Addu City. 45 participants from island communities learned essential digital skills for the modern economy.
Ooredoo Maldives continues to expand world-class connectivity across all atolls. Digital inclusion remains a priority under Maldives 2.0.
Maldives has achieved commendable literacy rates but we need to invest in digital literacy urgently. The future economy demands it.
Bridging the digital divide is essential for inclusive growth. We must ensure all islands have equal access to technology and connectivity.
Sun Travels launches next-gen booking system powered by AI. Digital transformation is reshaping Maldives tourism industry.
Ministry launches Digital Skills Development Program targeting youth in outer atolls. 500 participants expected by end of 2025.
#WomenInTechMV celebrates 5 years of empowering women in technology. Over 1000 women have received tech training since 2020.
The digital transformation agenda is promising but implementation in outer islands remains slow. We need more concrete action.
Analysis: How Maldives 2.0 is changing the face of public services. E-governance adoption rates increasing across ministries.
National Center for Information Technology hosts cybersecurity awareness week. Digital safety education for government employees.
BML launches digital banking features supporting SMEs. Mobile payments now available across all islands.
Youth innovation hub opens in Hulhumale. Space dedicated to fostering tech startups and digital entrepreneurship.
Digital health records system pilot begins in Greater Male area. Patient information now accessible through secure online portal.
Exciting to see the progress in digital government services. OneGov portal has simplified so many bureaucratic processes.
Dhiraagu 5G network now covers 95% of populated islands. Commitment to digital connectivity for all Maldivians.
Coding workshop for students in Thinadhoo completed. 30 young people introduced to programming and web development.
Opinion: Digital transformation must not leave behind vulnerable communities. Accessibility concerns need addressing.
Smart island pilot project launched in Fuvahmulah. IoT sensors for waste management and energy monitoring deployed.
Impressed by the e-visa system. Got my permit processed in hours instead of days. Digital transformation working!
Maldives Internet Governance Forum 2025 kicks off. Stakeholders discuss future of digital policy in the country. #mvigf2025
Local fintech startup raises funding for payment solutions. Growing ecosystem of digital innovation in Maldives.
Digital archives project preserves historical documents. Cultural heritage meets modern technology under Maldives 2.0.
The pace of digital change in Maldives is remarkable. From e-governance to AI - we are witnessing a transformation.
Webinar on digital rights and online safety attracts 200 participants. Awareness growing on digital citizenship.
Report: Digital economy could contribute 10% of GDP by 2027 if current momentum continues. Promising outlook.
President addresses Digital Government Week. Reiterates commitment to citizen-centric e-services.
Tech conference in Male showcases local innovation. Maldivian developers presenting AI and blockchain solutions.
Concerned about data privacy in the rush to digitize everything. We need stronger data protection laws.
Digital entrepreneurship program graduates 50 women. Ready to launch online businesses and e-commerce ventures.
Agreement signed with international partners for submarine cable maintenance. Ensuring reliable connectivity.
Year in review: 2025 was the year digital transformation became real in Maldives. Key milestones covered.
Looking forward to what 2026 brings for digital Maldives. The foundation is laid, now execution matters.
Digital payment transactions up 150% in 2025. Cashless economy becoming reality in urban Maldives.
